channel.title: Quick question
channel.description:
How can you make a button send a form 10 times?
Like.. (example only) Say you click a normal button, it sends the e-mail. I want it to send 10 e-mails when you click that one button, not just 1 e-mail.. How would I do this?

item.title: Quick question
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

What Epic Steve suggested should work, check to see if you have any other form declarations within your page.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick question
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

object:

In your “post.php” file, just create a loop in there to deal with what was posted 10 times. You don’t need to post it 10 times, since if you even could do that, it would be the same data.

[quote=“Muroth, post:5, topic:356456”][quote author=Epic Steve link=topic=452994.msg3318740#msg3318740 date=1282521237]
I’m going to need to see the post.php file, remove all personal data.
[/quote]

Actually it’s from a website, i just took it off, I don’t have access to it >.<[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Quick question
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“object, post:8, topic:356456”]In your “post.php” file, just create a loop in there to deal with what was posted 10 times. You don’t need to post it 10 times, since if you even could do that, it would be the same data.[/quote]That ^^…

Processing isn’t something you’ll ever get out of HTML.

Read full topic

@Protosstribe wrote:

In your “post.php” file, just create a loop in there to deal with what was posted 10 times. You don’t need to post it 10 times, since if you even could do that, it would be the same data.

item.title: Quick question
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

Oh, well you could use Javascript as a way.

function doscript() {
    for (i = 0; i <= 5; i++)
    {
        

    }
}

This might work.

<script type="text/javascript">
function doscript() {
    for (i = 0; i <= 5; i++)
    {
        document.forms[0].submit()
    }
}
</script>


<td>Post a message</td>
<td>
<form action='post.php' onsubmit='doscript()'>Subject:
<br>
<input type='text' name='subject' size='20'>
<br>
Your message:
<br>
<textarea name='yourpost' rows='5' cols='30'>
</textarea>
<br>
<input type='submit' name='submit' value='Post Topic'> //want to make it so it posts 10 times, not just once
</form>
</td>
</table>

Read full topic
